Posts.Content: Dela wrote: Hello community: I have recently been diagnosed w two types of cancer in one breast. 1.2 cm tumor. Lobular invasive and 5.8 mm Ductal invasive Hr2+ Both early detection. The good news is that from imaging...mri, mamo, ultra sound and biopsy of one small swollen axillarylymph nodes, there are no apparent lymph nodes involved. They will do a sentinel lymph nodes test during surgery which has only a 10 percent chance for it to come out positive, according to the doctors I know The Hr2+ is quiet aggressive and that’s what scares me :( But the doctors are telling me it’s unusually small. All this is very new to me so any feedback is appreciated . Also what probable treatments are coming up for me. I will be having masectomy in two days. Thank you for your kindsupport Greetings from. Madrid, Spain Dela Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Surgery on Thursday - masectomy Dela CarolAnnieLumpLump
